wikipedia_page.main: Robert Linn (born 10 October 1985) is a Scottish footballer who plays as a striker, he plays for Scottish Championship club Arbroath. Linn started his career with Dundee before signing for Peterhead. He then moved to Greenock Morton, from whom he joined East Fife, initially on loan. After spending a year in the Juniors with Ballingry Rovers, Linn signed for Arbroath in June 2013.

response: | Bobby Linn || rowspan="2" style="text-align:center;"|12 || Greenock Morton

Before the season kicked off confidence was starting to grow that Arbroath could mount a serious title challenge. Campbell was keen to construct his own side and was active in the summer transfer window, with signings including Ryan McCord and Colin Hamilton. These acquisitions helped to bolster a squad which many felt had sufficient quality, mainly provided through star-man Bobby Linn, but lacked the confidence required to succeed.
